verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered, <WH6030>
"Listen <WH8085> diligently <WH8085> to my speech. <WH4405> Let this be your consolation. <WH8575>
Allow <WH5375> me, <WH1696> and I also will speak; After <WH310> I have spoken, <WH1696> mock on. <WH3932>
As for me, <WH7879> is my complaint to man? <WH120> Why shouldn't <WH7307> I be impatient? <WH7114>
Look <WH6437> at me, <WH8074> and be astonished. Lay <WH7760> your hand <WH3027> on your mouth. <WH6310>
When I remember, <WH2142> I am troubled. <WH926> Horror <WH6427> takes hold of <WH270> my flesh. <WH1320>
"Why do the wicked <WH7563> live, <WH2421> become old, <WH6275> yes, <WH1396> and grow mighty in power? <WH2428>
Their child <WH2233> is established <WH3559> with them in their sight, <WH6440> their offspring <WH6631> before their eyes. <WH5869>
Their houses <WH1004> are safe <WH7965> from fear, <WH6343> neither is the rod <WH7626> of God upon them. <WH433>
Their bulls <WH7794> breed <WH5674> without fail. <WH1602> Their cows <WH6510> calve, <WH6403> and don't <WH7921> miscarry.
They send forth <WH7971> their little ones <WH5759> like a flock. <WH6629> Their children <WH3206> dance. <WH7540>
They sing <WH5375> to the tambourine <WH8596> and harp, <WH3658> and rejoice <WH8055> at the sound <WH6963> of the pipe. <WH5748>
They spend <WH3615> their days <WH3117> in prosperity. <WH2896> In an instant <WH7281> they go down <WH2865> to Sheol. <WH7585>
They tell <WH559> God, <WH410> <WH5493> 'Depart from us, <WH2654> for we don't want to know <WH1847> about your ways. <WH1870>
What is the Almighty, <WH7706> that we should serve <WH5647> him? <WH3276> What profit should we have, <WH6293> if we pray to him?'
Behold, <WH2898> their prosperity is not in their hand. <WH3027> The counsel <WH6098> of the wicked <WH7563> is far from me. <WH7368>

"How often is it that the lamp <WH5216> of the wicked <WH7563> is put out, <WH1846> that their calamity <WH343> comes <WH935> on them, <WH2505> that God distributes sorrows <WH2256> in his anger? <WH639>
How often is it that they are as stubble <WH8401> before <WH6440> the wind, <WH7307> as chaff <WH4671> that the storm <WH5492> carries away? <WH1589>
You say, <WH433> 'God lays up <WH6845> his iniquity <WH205> for his children. <WH1121>' Let him recompense <WH7999> it to himself, <WH3045> that he may know it.
Let his own eyes <WH5869> see <WH7200> his destruction. <WH3589> Let him drink <WH8354> of the wrath <WH2534> of the Almighty. <WH7706>
For what does he care <WH2656> for his house <WH1004> after <WH310> him, <WH4557> when the number of his months <WH2320> is cut off? <WH2686>
"Shall any teach <WH3925> God <WH410> knowledge, <WH1847> since he judges <WH8199> those who are high? <WH7311>
One dies <WH4191> in his full <WH8537> strength, <WH6106> being wholly at ease <WH7946> and quiet. <WH7961>
His pails <WH5845> are full <WH4390> of milk. <WH2461> The marrow <WH4221> of his bones <WH6106> is moistened. <WH8248>
Another dies <WH4191> in bitterness <WH4751> of soul, <WH5315> and never tastes <WH398> of good. <WH2896>
They lie down <WH7901> alike <WH3162> in the dust. <WH6083> The worm <WH7415> covers them. <WH3680>
"Behold, <WH3045> I know your thoughts, <WH4284> the devices <WH4209> with which you would wrong me. <WH2554>
For you say, <WH559> <WH1004> 'Where is the house of the prince? <WH5081> Where is the tent <WH4908> in which the wicked <WH7563> lived? <WH4908>'
Haven't <WH7592> you asked wayfaring <WH1870> men? <WH5674> Don't <WH5234> you know their evidences, <WH226>
that the evil <WH7451> man is reserved <WH2820> to the day <WH3117> of calamity, <WH343> That they are led forth <WH2986> to the day <WH3117> of wrath? <WH5678>
Who shall declare <WH5046> his way <WH1870> to his face? <WH6440> Who shall repay <WH7999> him what he has done? <WH6213>
Yet he will be borne <WH2986> to the grave. <WH6913> Men shall keep watch <WH8245> over the tomb. <WH1430>
The clods <WH7263> of the valley <WH5158> shall be sweet <WH4985> to him. <WH120> All men shall draw <WH4900> after <WH310> him, <WH4557> as there were innumerable before him. <WH6440>
So how can you comfort <WH5162> me with nonsense, <WH1892> because in your answers <WH8666> there remains <WH7604> only falsehood? <WH4604>"
